algorithms

Class Grover

  • java.lang.Object
    • algorithms.Grover
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Algorithm
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ArraySearch

    public class Grover
extends java.lang.Object
implements Algorithm
    Class which defines an implementation of Grover's algorithm
    Author:
    Andru, Charlie, Sam

    • Constructor Detail

      • Grover

        public Grover(int numQubits,
      int omega)
        Constructor
        Parameters:
        numQubits - number of qubits
        omega - value we are searching for

    • Method Detail

      • searchState

        protected int searchState()
        This is the actual implementation of the algorithm, used to search for the state omega. It's useful to implement this separate from run function in order to allow multiple calls if it doesn't not succeed on the first one (there is a small probability of that happening).
        Returns:
        returns value obtained via Grover's algorithm

      • run

        public void run()
        Description copied from interface: Algorithm
        Runs the algorithm
        Specified by:
        run in interface Algorithm

      • test

        protected boolean test(int state)
        This is the function, f, that will be used in the oracle operator. It returns true when the current state is the one we are looking for
        Parameters:
        state - current state
        Returns:
        true if current state is the one we are looking or, false otherwise

      • blackBox

        private Operator blackBox()
        Oracle operator. Take state |x>|q> -> |x>|q (+) f(x)>, where f(x) is 1 if x is the state we're looking for and 0 otherwise. (+) denotes xor operation.
        Returns:
        black box operator that identifies state we are searching for

      • diffusion

        private Operator diffusion()
        Diffusion operator, leaves 0 state unchanged but negates all the others. Since this is applied to all but the first qubit, we are interested in the 0 state for qubits 1-numQubits, so the verification is done for (state >> 1).
        Returns:
        returns diffusion operator
